unnormalised: Automotive Industry Gears Up for a Flurry of Vehicle Launches!
normalised: Automotive Industry Gears Up for a Flurry of Vehicle Launches!

unnormalised: This quarter promises a showcase of innovation as several major manufacturers are set to unveil their latest offerings. Experts at IIT Madras are closely watching the developments, predicting a surge in demand, especially in the SUV segment.
normalised: This quarter promises a showcase of innovation as several major manufacturers are set to unveil their latest offerings. Experts at I I T Madras are closely watching the developments, predicting a surge in demand, especially in the S U V segment.

unnormalised: Maruti Suzuki is expected to launch the next-gen Alto 800 with enhanced fuel efficiency and safety features, targeting the budget-conscious Indian consumer. Meanwhile, Tata Motors is rumored to be debuting its much-anticipated electric micro-SUV, challenging existing EV options.
normalised: Maruti Suzuki is expected to launch the next-gen Alto eight hundred with enhanced fuel efficiency and safety features, targeting the budget-conscious Indian consumer. Meanwhile, Tata Motors is rumored to be debuting its much-anticipated electric micro-S U V, challenging existing E V options.

unnormalised: Mahindra is also in the race with a refreshed Scorpio, boasting a more powerful engine and improved off-roading capabilities, catering to the adventurous spirit.
normalised: Mahindra is also in the race with a refreshed Scorpio, boasting a more powerful engine and improved off-roading capabilities, catering to the adventurous spirit.

unnormalised: Dr. Sharma, a leading automotive analyst, suggests consumers compare models carefully, considering factors like mileage (km per liter), safety ratings, and after-sales service. Prices for these new vehicles are expected to range from Rs. 4 lakhs to Rs. 15 lakhs, depending on the model and variant.
normalised: Doctor Sharma, a leading automotive analyst, suggests consumers compare models carefully, considering factors like mileage (kilometer per liter), safety ratings, and after-sales service. Prices for these new vehicles are expected to range from rupee four lakhs to rupee fifteen lakhs, depending on the model and variant.

unnormalised: Many are also paying attention to ADAS (Advanced Driver Assistance Systems), now finding their way even into smaller cars. Dealerships are prepping showrooms covering thousands of sq ft to accommodate the influx of potential buyers, anticipating a Diwali season boost.
normalised: Many are also paying attention to A D A S (Advanced Driver Assistance Systems), now finding their way even into smaller cars. Dealerships are prepping showrooms covering thousands of square feet to accommodate the influx of potential buyers, anticipating a Diwali season boost.
